item.title: 美国联邦航空局官员称目前不考虑取消波音 737 MAX 生产上限
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局代理局长表示，他目前不考虑取消波音737 MAX飞机每月38架的生产上限，因为2024年1月阿拉斯加航空公司一架波音新飞机在空中发生紧急情况，缺少四个关键螺栓。【原文：The acting head of the Federal Aviation Administration said he is not currently considering lifting a production cap of 38 planes per month on Boeing's 737 MAX imposed after a January 2024 mid-air emergency involving a new Alaska Airlines Boeing plane missing four key bolts.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，SES 31 亿美元的通信卫星组织交易将获得欧盟无条件的反垄断批准
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，欧洲卫星公司 SES 出价 31 亿美元收购竞争对手 Intelsat 的交易将获得欧盟无条件的反垄断批准，从而在欧洲形成一个可与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Space X 旗下 Starlink 公司相抗衡的主要竞争者。【原文：European satellite company SES is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $3.1-billion bid for rival Intelsat, people familiar with the matter said, creating a major European player to rival Elon Musk's Space X-owned Starlink.】

item.title: 美国国会预算办公室认为特朗普关税导致经济产出下降
item.description: 无党派的国会预算办公室周三表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统自5月13日起对外国商品征收的新关税将导致美国经济产出下降，同时也会使联邦预算赤字在十年内减少2.8万亿美元。【原文：U.S. economic output will fall as a result of President Donald Trump's new tariffs on foreign goods that were in place as of May 13, while also reducing federal budget deficits by $2.8 trillion over a decade, the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 麦道夫客户收回 4.98 亿美元，赔付金额高达 150 亿美元
item.description: 根据周三与两家卢森堡基金清算人达成的和解协议，已故庞氏骗局策划者伯纳德-麦道夫的前客户将收回 4.983 亿美元，从而使他们收回的资金增至约 152.6 亿美元。【原文：Former customers of the late Ponzi schemer Bernard Madoff will recoup $498.3 million under a settlement on Wednesday with the liquidators of two Luxembourg funds, boosting their recovery to about $15.26 billion.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：苹果和阿里巴巴在中国推出人工智能的计划因特朗普的贸易战而推迟
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，苹果和阿里巴巴在中国推出人工智能服务的计划被北京监管机构推迟。【原文：Apple and Alibaba's rollout of artificial intelligence services in China is being delayed by a Beijing regulator, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊将在北卡罗来纳州投资 100 亿美元，扩建云计算和人工智能基础设施
item.description: 亚马逊公司周三表示，计划在北卡罗来纳州投资 100 亿美元，以扩大其云计算和人工智能基础设施。【原文：Amazon.com said on Wednesday it is planning to invest $10 billion in North Carolina to expand its cloud computing and artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 特朗普政府重新谈判 "过于慷慨 "的拜登芯片法案补助金
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）在周三举行的听证会上表示，特朗普政府正在重新谈判一些对半导体公司 "过于慷慨 "的拨款，这些拨款是前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）时期签署的《芯片法案》（Chips Act）的一部分。【原文：The Trump administration is renegotiating some "overly generous" grants to semiconductor firms that were signed as part of the Chips Act under former President Joe Biden, U.S. Commerce Department Secretary Howard Lutnick said at a hearing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 渴望交易的股权投资者关注欧洲潜在的国防工业繁荣
item.description: 在柏林举行的年度会议上，全球投资者和顾问们正在考虑将资金引入欧洲的国防工业，力图从政府增加军费开支中获利，并重振低迷的私募股权市场。【原文：Global investors and advisers gathered at their annual conference in Berlin are looking at channelling funds into Europe's defence industry, seeking to profit from governments' ramped-up military spending and revive a sluggish private equity market.】

item.title: 新数据显示，Nvidia 芯片在训练最大规模人工智能系统方面取得进展
item.description: 本周三发布的最新数据显示，Nvidia 最新芯片在训练大型人工智能系统方面取得了进展，训练大型语言模型所需的芯片数量大幅减少。【原文：Nvidia's newest chips have made gains in training large artificial intelligence systems, new data released on Wednesday showed, with the number of chips required to train large language models dropping dramatically.】

item.title: 工会称，由于 Stellantis 更换了石油供应商，意大利 500 多个工作岗位面临风险
item.description: 意大利一家工会周三表示，意大利汽车制造商 Stellantis 将石油供应商从马来西亚国家石油公司（Petronas）旗下的一个本地品牌更换为法国道达尔公司（Total）后，500 多个工作岗位面临风险。【原文：More than 500 jobs are at risk in Italy after automaker Stellantis changed oil supplier from a local brand owned by Malaysia's Petronas to France's Total , a trade union said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国领先的钢铁和铝进口公司
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三开始对进口钢铁和铝--从建筑到包装等行业使用的关键材料--加征关税，将关税从之前的25%提高到50%。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's increased tariffs on imported steel and aluminum - key materials used in industries ranging from construction to packaging - kicked in on Wednesday, pushing duties to 50% from 25% previously.】

item.title: 印度韦丹塔公司称特朗普关税具有破坏性，寻求限制进口
item.description: 印度从金属到石油的企业集团韦丹塔公司（Vedanta）周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将铝关税提高一倍至50%，这对已经在进口激增中挣扎的印度工业构成了威胁。【原文：Indian metals-to-oil conglomerate Vedanta said on Wednesday that U.S. President Donald Trump's doubling of aluminium tariffs to 50% poses a threat to the Indian industry already struggling with surging imports.】

item.title: 在微软高管调整中，LinkedIn 首席执行官将接管 Office 和更多人工智能职责
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的一份微软首席执行官萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）的备忘录，LinkedIn首席执行官将额外负责微软的Office产品，而负责该公司一款领先的企业对企业人工智能产品的高管将开始向该公司Windows部门的负责人汇报工作。【原文：The CEO of LinkedIn will take additional responsibility for Microsoft's Office products, while an executive responsible for one of the company's leading business-to-business artificial intelligence products will start reporting to head of the company's Windows unit, according to a memo from Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella viewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 迪拜派对酒店 FIVE 考虑在伦敦或纽约上市
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，迪拜派对酒店运营商 FIVE Holdings 正在考虑在伦敦或纽约上市。【原文：Dubai party hotel operator FIVE Holdings is considering listing in London or New York, three people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 大多数新兴市场货币将保持涨势
item.description: 路透社（Reuters）对外汇策略师进行的一项民意调查显示，随着交易商放弃助长美元梦幻般上涨的美国例外论交易，大多数新兴市场货币将在未来六个月内保持今年以来的涨势，或扩大兑美元的涨幅。【原文：Most emerging market currencies will hold the gains they have made this year or extend them against a retreating dollar in the next six months as traders ditch the U.S. exceptionalism trade that fuelled the greenback's dream run, a Reuters poll of FX strategists found.】

item.title: 中国就驾驶辅助系统安全要求征求公众意见
item.description: 国家标准数据库周三显示，中国正在就驾驶辅助系统的安全要求征求公众意见，截止日期为 7 月 4 日。【原文：China is seeking public comment on safety requirements for driving assistance systems until July 4, the national standards database showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 5 月服务业意外萎缩；通胀升温
item.description: 5 月份，美国服务业出现了近一年来的首次萎缩，同时企业支付的投入品价格上涨，这提醒人们，经济仍有可能经历一段增长非常缓慢而通胀率居高不下的时期。【原文：The U.S. services sector contracted for the first time in nearly a year in May while businesses paid higher prices for inputs, a reminder that the economy remained in danger of experiencing a period of very slow growth and high inflation.】

item.title: 谷歌称黑客滥用修改后的 Salesforce 应用程序窃取数据并敲诈公司
item.description: 谷歌（Google）周三表示，黑客正在诱骗欧洲和美洲的公司员工安装一个修改版的Salesforce相关应用程序，从而允许黑客窃取大量数据、访问其他企业云服务并敲诈这些公司。【原文：Hackers are tricking employees at companies in Europe and the Americas into installing a modified version of a Salesforce-related app, allowing the hackers to steal reams of data, gain access to other corporate cloud services and extort those companies, Google said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特朗普减税法案可能耗资 2.4 万亿美元，低于此前预测
item.description: 无党派的国会预算办公室周三下调了对唐纳德-特朗普总统的减税和支出法案将增加多少国债的估计，称该法案将使美国36.2万亿美元的债务增加约2.4万亿美元。【原文：The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office on Wednesday lowered its estimate how much President Donald Trump's tax-cut and spending bill will add to the national debt, saying it would add about $2.4 trillion to the nation's $36.2 trillion in liabilities.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利抵制倍耐力要求加强对中国股东限制的呼吁
item.description: 消息人士称，意大利政府正在抵制倍耐力执行副主席马尔科-特隆切蒂-普罗维拉（Marco Tronchetti Provera）提出的加强对轮胎制造商的中国投资者实施限制的要求。【原文：The Italian government is resisting calls from Pirelli's executive vice-chairman Marco Tronchetti Provera to tighten curbs imposed on the tyremaker's Chinese investor, sources said.】

item.title: 纽约联储调查：上月大多数企业转嫁了部分关税激增的影响
item.description: 纽约联储周三发布的一份报告称，纽约联储辖区内的大多数企业表示，上个月他们至少以提高价格的形式转嫁了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的部分关税，因为企业在应对进口税激增的过程中遇到了相当大的困惑和不确定性。【原文：The majority of businesses in the New York Federal Reserve’s district said they passed on at least some of President Donald Trump’s tariffs in the form of higher prices last month, as firms flagged considerable confusion and uncertainty in navigating the surge in import taxes, a report from the bank released on Wednesday said.】

item.title: 欧盟与中国在领导人峰会前解决贸易问题
item.description: 欧盟贸易负责人周三表示，布鲁塞尔和北京正在努力工作，以便在七月的峰会之前解决双方贸易关系中的问题。【原文：The European Union's trade chief on Wednesday said Brussels and Beijing were working hard to address issues in their trade relationship ahead of a July summit, as Europe joined a chorus of alarm over China's stranglehold on critical minerals.】

item.title: 中国通过新的跟踪系统加强对稀土磁铁的审查
item.description: 三位消息人士称，随着稀土磁铁出口限制开始切断世界各地的客户，中国已针对稀土磁铁行业引入了一套跟踪系统。【原文：China has introduced a tracking system for its rare earth magnet sector, three sources said, as its export restrictions on them begin to cut off customers around the world.】

item.title: 雷神公司获得 11 亿美元的美国海军合同，将生产更多短程导弹
item.description: RTX 的防务部门雷神公司（Raytheon）周三表示，它已获得美国海军 11 亿美元的合同，将生产更多的短程 AIM-9X Block II 导弹。【原文：RTX's defense arm Raytheon said on Wednesday it has been awarded a $1.1 billion contract from the U.S. Navy to produce more of its short-range AIM-9X Block II missiles.】

item.title: 英国 Warehouse REIT 同意 Blackstone 6.3535 亿美元的出价
item.description: 英国 Warehouse REIT 已同意以 4.7 亿英镑（6.3535 亿美元）的价格出售给 Blackstone，几天前该投资公司因在尽职调查中发现的估值相关问题而降低了对该公司的出价。【原文：UK's Warehouse REIT has agreed to sell itself to Blackstone for 470 million pounds ($635.35 million), days after the investment firm lowered its bid for the company due to valuation-related issues uncovered during due diligence.】

item.title: 巴西货币近期持平，受制于贸易担忧：路透调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，巴西的雷亚尔货币预计在未来几个月的交易中将相对稳定，但会受到对该国对外收支恶化的担忧的抑制。【原文：Brazil's real currency is expected to trade relatively steady in coming months, restrained by concerns over a deterioration in the country's external accounts, a Reuters poll showed.】

item.title: 意法半导体首席执行官表示未来三年将裁员 5000 人
item.description: 意法半导体（STMicroelectronics）首席执行官周三表示，预计未来三年将有 5000 名员工离职，其中包括今年早些时候宣布的 2800 个裁员岗位。【原文：STMicroelectronics expects 5,000 staff to leave the company in the next three years, including 2,800 job cuts announced earlier this year, its chief executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 茁壮成长的克里特会计公司将斥资 5 亿美元推广人工智能技术
item.description: 克里特专业人士联盟（Crete Professionals Alliance）是一家由茁壮资本（Thrive Capital）支持的会计平台，公司高管告诉路透社，该公司计划在未来两年内投资超过 5 亿美元收购美国的会计师事务所，并为其配备 OpenAI 驱动的人工智能技术，以提高效率。【原文：Crete Professionals Alliance, an accounting platform backed by Thrive Capital, plans to invest over $500 million to acquire U.S.-based accounting firms in the next two years, and equip them with OpenAI-powered artificial intelligence technology to boost efficiency, company executives told Reuters.】

item.title: 英国首相斯塔默相信美国将在关税截止日期前达成协议
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）周三表示，他有信心在 "几周内 "将美国进口英国钢铁的关税降至零，从而避免在7月的最后期限前将关税跃升至50%。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Wednesday he was confident that tariffs on U.S. imports of British steel would be reduced to zero within a "couple of weeks", avoiding a July deadline which could see the levies jump to 50%.】

item.title: GlobalFoundries 将投资计划提高到 160 亿美元，重点放在研究领域
item.description: 芯片制造商 GlobalFoundries 周三表示，计划将投资计划增加到 160 亿美元，其中 10 亿美元用于资本支出，30 亿美元用于几项新兴芯片技术的研究。【原文：Chip manufacturer GlobalFoundries said on Wednesday it planned to increase its investment plans to $16 billion, allocating an additional $1 billion to capital spending and $3 billion to research in several emerging chip technologies.】
